Articles.Content:
I am using KSP 1 0.5 on linux (64bit) with Mechjeb, Docking Alignment, Scansat, Alarm Clock and Chatter Mods enabled.

Pressing F1 does generate a "screenshot", however it turns out to be plain black. It is not an empty or corrupted file which is being generated - it is all black.

 

Any ideas on how to fix that issue?

 

Edited January 23, 2016 by something

Can you post a screenshot of the problem?

Sorry, couldn't resist. I'm afraid I can't help much (not a linux user), but this type of question really might have better luck being answered by knowledgeable people over in the Technical Support (modded installs) forum.  Maybe ask a moderator to move it?

Sorry I can't be of more help.

Just in case anybody encounters the same problem:
I was unable to get the ingame screenshot to work, however, Ubuntu comes along with a snapshot tool which is capable of doing the job. Pressing the print key does the job for me, even if operated in fullscreen mode.
Question moved to modded support. Good luck with it.

I have the same issue. Also 1.0.5 64 bit on Linux.

Some of the screenshots are not all black but a "pixel mess".

It seems that the game resolution plays a role. Usually, I play on 1280*720. The issue was gone it was set to a higher resolution (forgot which one).

Same problem as dhotmes, but on Mac OS Sierra, KSP 1.2.2.

 

 

 

Edited May 24, 2017 by Scott Vandezande
Me too, but I think a mod is to blame. Added a lot of mods recently and can't pinpoint the culprit
